metadata.title: CVE-2023-38898 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: ** DISPUTED ** An issue in Python cpython v.3.7 allows an attacker toobtain sensitive information via the _asyncio._swap_current_task component.NOTE: this is disputed by the vendor because (1) neither 3.7 nor any otherrelease is affected (it is a bug in some 3.12 pre-releases); (2) there areno common scenarios in which an adversary can call_asyncio._swap_current_task but does not already have the ability to callarbitrary functions; and (3) there are no common scenarios in whichsensitive information, which is not already accessible to an adversary,becomes accessible through this bug.

criterions.comment: python2.7: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
python3.4: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
python3.5: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
